comment.body: omg :D this is crazy, and they can vote! :(

IMHO just being a centralized system with that many users, by design, lowers the cost and increases the benefit for anyone who want to influence / control / manipulate / ..... and it applies to the good, as well as to the bad things.

no, there's no way to access to bitcoins without private key, it's a tradeoff for being secure without having to depend on a 3rd party. Remember that bitcoin is infinitely dividable, so we'll never run out of coins :)

@Ulrichard yeah, currently, but it may be much more easier to divide even further (update the network) than implementing something global garbage collection which will take your bitcoins if you don't hug them within a few ~years ;)

I think in a slightly different way; for me, saying "stupid" is just a way of saying "I don't understand, but doesn't agree, and don't care". Which can be totally reasonable in many cases as we have finite amount of resources (time / etc) so we need to spend it wisely.

It happens me from time to time, and that's when garbage collection happens in the background; I think it  because when I let it finish, the everything is much better, but if I force myself to do what I've started / productive / important things, it's much longer and my motivation stays ~low.
